pros: As a student, it is very convenient to work on campus. Setting up direct deposit was very simple and quick. The managers and everyone else I've met at OIT thus far has been very nice. My managers have been more than happy to work around my class schedule. They understand that I am a student first.
cons: That I can only work this job as a student!

job_title: PhD Candidate in Morehead City, NC
pros: Good resources, great access to other institution resources as well. Overall not a bad place to pursue a PhD, examine other local choices too.
cons: Benefits are not great, as is the case with nearly all other state government-related agencies and institutions in North Carolina. Keep that in mind.

pros: Department of materials science and engineering in NCSU is a good college with first-rate research conditions and excellent professors.
cons: Most research in department of materials science and engineering focus on industrialization such metal and ceramic. The fundamental research show some weakness.

review_title: good place to study and work
pros: good place to study and work, nice weather at Raleigh, all kinds of majors except medical school. as long as you have a nice advisor, your RA life here will be great
cons: there are too many students in some classes and major, would be better if keep the quality instead of the quantity.

job_title: General Shop Worker in Raleigh, NC
pros: Great People and a Great Environment. Even the higher ups are interactive. Loved working during the summer. Low stress job with good pay.
cons: HR refuses to acknowledge reviews and opinions of anyone inside division. Must reapply each summer, despite being a valuable asset.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Raleigh, NC
pros: I work as a Graduate Research Assistant here and it really depends on the faculty you work under. Pay is decent and you get to network with lots of industry veterans as part of your research work as most of the work is in collaboration with them.
cons: Balancing research work with graduate level course load can make you spend sleepless nights.

review_title: Great place to be a student
job_title: Graduate Research Student in Raleigh, NC
pros: Relaxed environment with courteous staff that take good care of employees. The ECE grad student office is always helpful. NCSU has one of the the best faculty and research facilities in engineering in the US.
cons: Some people might not like the quiet and laid back lifestyle in Raleigh, compared to more happening major cities of the country. But, I like it!

job_title: Equipment Room Attendant in Raleigh, NC
pros: Hours were somewhat flexible around school schedule, work was located close to class, got to interact with many other students.
cons: Management was not the most considerate, some older employees acted inappropriately, pay was minimum wage, work was hard with few breaks.

job_title: Sports Programs Supervisor in Chocowinity, NC
pros: NCSU University Recreation offers a super-flexible schedule to their employees. Also, the environment is very friendly and relaxed.
cons: I don't see any major flaws with working for University Recreation. I really like working here, and I plan on being here for a while.

job_title: Emergency Veterinary Technician in Raleigh, NC
pros: The veterinary college has some amazing technology and amazing minds at work.
cons: Human Resources, management, and even Medical Residents are incredibly rude and insensitive. Employees are treated as machines with the mentality that everyone is replaceable.

pros: good place, low expense, suitable environment, convenient traffic. The most important thing is, the people here are very very nice.
cons: The life here sometimes is boring, which may be the reason that you can concentrate on the academic and industry work.

pros: NC State is a great place to work . The state treats employees how they should be treated. I loved my co-workers, we all worked together to get assignments done.
cons: Unfortunatley, some departments can be hard to work in.  I suggest to stand your ground and know your stuff.

pros: There were a lot of nice people that were willing to help you get used to the job.  If you helped someone out they would help you out in return
cons: The only real downside was the redundancy of the timecard system.  Even though everything was logged in the system, we had to print out the timesheet and bring it to our manager's office.

pros: Highly flexible hours & scheduling. Supervisors are supportive but also hands-off enough to allow you to work independently.  Collaborative and interactive training sessions. Helping other students is in itself rewarding.
cons: Mediocre pay. Time-consuming initial training.

pros: job opportunity in the university career center is good. The classes normally are useful. Students are very friendly. Life here is convenient.
cons: Some of the professors are bad. They fired students for no reason, just simply tell them there is no funding.

review_title: I worked as a Research and Teaching Assistant.
job_title: Teaching and Research Assistant in Raleigh, NC
pros: The position was flexible, it allowed me to work closely with the staff and professors in the college and gain valuable work experience in a field I was studying
cons: There weren't really any cons. It was a great fit for a student looking for experience and the professor I worked for was respected in his field.

pros:
- Working with a team who value all types of diversity, not just race
- Feeling like you are actually making a difference in the lives of students/staff/faculty
cons: - Salary and work life balance are low depending upon which office you work in, however administration is understanding of employee's needs and will work to find a compromise

review_title: Overall it was good, but it varies.
pros: The campus community is vibrant and fun.  The academics and research are top quality.  There are a lot of different things happening across campus at any given time.
cons: The pay is not very competitive for the types of activities NCSU is trying to do.  The environment is highly political.

pros: Graduate student support program, working with like minded people, competitive salary/stipend, location is great (teach classes on campus while you're attending classes)
cons: Only part time employment is offered so only part time salaries/ stipends are awarded.  Unfortunately the cost of living is higher than the stipend so you'll be eating Ramen noodles while you're in school, but it's better than nothing!

review_title: NCSU DELTA (Distance Education and Learning Technology Applications) Center
pros: The Instructional Support Services (ISS) team is fun, vibrant, and creative. Work that comes through is exciting and diverse, and the teams are flexible. Culture is lively! The office is on Centennial Campus and is a beautiful building, and food trucks abound for lunch.
cons: A lot of the projects that cycles through are annual repeats

job_title: Facilities Maintenance Supervisor in Raleigh, NC
pros: You receive a lot of leave time and the benefits are good. It's also a beautiful campus close to downtown Raleigh.
cons: You are working for a state agency, so it can take a long time to get the answers you need. It is also difficult to move up because of how they have everyone career banded.

review_title: Decent entry-level (Center for Urban Affairs and Community Services)
pros: This job has good flexibility and relatively low stress most of the time (except for seasonal crunch times). It has decent benefits and good vacation and sick leave.
cons: Hard to improve on base salary, and little room to negotiate. No real room for growth in this position/ department.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Raleigh, NC
pros: Great job! You get a comprehensive health insurance as well. Pay is good  to support your education. If you get a teaching assistant position, generally your tuition is covered as well.
cons: You have to be in constant touch with your emails. Even on weekends , since students sometimes send you an email right before the submissions of a Saturday or Sunday

pros: Early Schedule, I am in at 7:00 am and out by 3:30. My supervisor is flexible in regards to having days off.  PTO, Retirement, wonderful health care plan.  Annual merit based bonuses.
cons: Health Care plan is a little pricey if you have dependents. Paid monthly. As a state employee your salary is subject to change due to legislation.

job_title: Rave! Event Support Staff in Raleigh, NC
pros: Pay was good for a student living on campus, and I loved my supervisors. It was a fun, fast-paced work environment that was a great way to get some work experience while taking classes.
cons: The hours were a bit strange since they were event-based, and the schedule changed constantly so it was hard to make plans more than a week in advance.

review_title: Was a graduate Student here. Had a great experience
pros: The environment is very academic. You will get enough exposure to industry, talks and seminars. The career fair is attended by many companies. The new Hunt library is great..
cons: The campus is made up of bricks... There are bricks everywhere!! Not enough control and AI related classes. The Oval canteen is not so good.

pros: A pro to working here is flexibility for students with class schedule however the pay is very minimal as they like to hire many students at a low rate.
cons: Like many places, there are a lot of politics involved and questionable actions are made despite being against mission statement.

review_title: Great people to work with but environment was unhealthy.
pros: Wonderful lifestyle job(lots of vacation) and some great benefits
cons: During my tenure of  four years, abuse of power and misogyny ran rapid. Incompetent people hired and  blatantly verbally abused female employees many times. Senior management too afraid to intervene. Many females finally left.

review_title: Great school with lots of professional development opportunities
pros: There are lots of people, offices, and opportunities on campus that work to make life better for grad assistants. Lots of professional development opportunities.
cons: With the heavy emphasis on professional development, it seems like we're constantly being pushed to submit journal articles, go to conferences, do service work, etc. and time management is very difficult.

pros: Decent hourly pay, good coworkers, good leadership
cons: Not enough hours to go around for all the employees, no mercy when it comes to being late or missing a day.

job_title: Bookstore Student Eployee in Raleigh, NC
pros: The manager was very fair, the hours were very flexible for students, gained a lot of experience.
cons: There was a very strict no cell phone policy, though understandable. Some of the assistant managers were unbearable.

job_title: IT Support Specialist in Raleigh, NC
pros: Job security!  The pay is decent for the cost of living in Raleigh.
cons: The university is being forced to be run more and more as a business due to economic trends.  I saw many "perks" eroded during my time spent there, unfortunately.  I doubt this is unique to NCSU, but I hope they can reverse that somehow.

review_title: Great colleagues, professional development opportunities, competitive salary
pros: I enjoyed my time at NC State.  I had Great colleagues, professional development opportunities are everywhere and encouraged, the work environment was great, and the salary ranges are competitive.
cons: Raises are scarce due to being at the whim of the legislature and state budgets, so getting a great starting salary is key.

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in Raleigh, NC
pros: The insurance allows you to go to Student Health and get almost everything there free of charge, including PT.
cons: TOO MANY ADMINISTRATORS and way too little efficiency. It's absolutely unreal how frustrating it is to deal with the purchasing department.

pros:
The atmosphere is great, especially for part-time students like myself. 
You get a free meal during each shift. 
As a student, they realize that school is more important.
cons: The management between the morning shift and night shift is too competitive. You feel like you are picking sides. Some people have been there too long and take advantage of the system.

job_title: Executive Administrative Assistant in Raleigh, NC
pros: Flexibility when needed. Nice amount of vacation time and holidays.
cons: As is common with government jobs, there is a lot of red tape.  Salaries are not competitive nor do they keep up with increasing cost of living. Raises are few and far between and are usually under 3%.

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in Raleigh, NC
pros: The Office of Postdoctoral Affairs offers outstanding career development programs for postdocs wishing to pursue careers in both academia and industry.
cons: Postdocs that want to attend classes to further their training are required to pay full tuition because they are temporary employees, and as such don't qualify for tuition waiver granted to employees.

pros: Teaching is great. Access to university resources is amazing in terms of databases. Lots of money around, but very little of it goes to the business of teaching.
cons: Higher education is woefully undervalued by the political party that has control over the state's executive and legislative branches. This makes it difficult to imagine a career in education in NC

job_title: Administrative Support Specialist in Raleigh, NC
pros:
Time off/paid holidays
Plenty of educational resources
Lots of departments to move around to
Depending on what college you work for, there is some flexibility
cons:
You are a state employee but NC State University pay is not that great for staff/administration
Difficult to move up as most positions are very specific so lateral moves are much easier

pros: Health benefits. That is really all I can says there is not much good I can say. The place, for me, has no real pros.
cons: Everything but the health benefits. They make you pay for parking, force you to take out 6% for retirement, let people get away with not working at all while people who work hard get everything dumped on them.

review_title: Student Perspective of Culture at NC State University
pros: NC State University highly values research, service, and diversity, creating a unique and innovative culture on campus.
cons: As may be expected, one of the greatest challenges at NC State University is making and maintaining a network of connections in order not to get "lost" in the large size of the university.

pros: Great place to work. Colleagues were supportive. Lots of events and lectures on campus so there was always something to do after work. Never bored.
cons: The demands of the job could be hard at times. When the pace picked up, we all had to pitch in and work overtime.

job_title: Research Technician in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: Good benefits and easy work. Straight forward and simple. Good management
cons: The mice had cleaner cages than the breakroom in DLAM. There were literally wild mice in the breakroom

pros: Research level is absolutely high
cons: Young Professors are hired based on their publication record and how much money they can bring. They are not hired based on their behaviour and relation with students.  Selfish attitude is visible. High-level students (PhD and Postdocs) are mistreated and their skills are misused in those projects that are not related to them.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Raleigh, NC
pros:
1. Great work atmosphere and talented people to work with.
2. Good exposure to state of art research facilities.
cons:
1. Per hour payment less than national average with very little hike over last 3 years.
2. Administrative workflow is quite slow.

job_title: Graduate Research Student in Raleigh, NC
pros: Research at NC state has a good focus on smart and advanced materials. Being one the RTP universities means there is plenty of opportunities toe explore career options: industry as well as academia.
cons: Pay, obviously. But that applies for most universities. On campus housing/dining is very expensive for students.

pros: They were very friendly, could learn the job easily and so it did not take much time to get habituated to the job
cons: The positions were mostly to the work study students which did not give everyone opportunity to work there

review_title: The University moving in the right direction
pros:
Better college and university leadership than in the past
Opportunities to work with others in the organization through research and university programs
cons:
No significant rewards for excellent teaching and student success
Poor metrics for organizational success, for example, we do not track students well

job_title: Human Resources Specialist in Raleigh, NC
pros: This has been a very good experience for me. I have been able to really grow and learn in my HR career. I work with great people, in a wonderful environment. Great work/life balance.
cons: We are state employees, but we are not treated like state employees. There isn't a lot of room for advancement as well.

review_title: University Recreation is a great place to work, especially within intramural sports.
job_title: Intramural Sports Official in Raleigh, NC
pros:
Convenient on-campus location (across the street from my dorm)
Very flexible hours
I feel respected and valuable
Great staff and great colleagues
Good working environment
Automatic pay increase after two consecutive semesters of work
cons: Annoying to deal with the players sometimes, but the intramural supervisors always have our backs.

review_title: This is a great place for a graduate student to work and study!
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Raleigh, NC
pros: Your graduate education is fully paid for, and the experience is extremely valuable when looking for a job after graduation.
cons: The hours can be somewhat long at time.  Additionally, the demands can be quite stressful, depending on who your advisor is.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Raleigh, NC
pros:
Great department with good community
Multiple research areas for depth and broad collaboration among peers and faculty
Laboratory/Campus still relatively new
Lots of things to do in the triangle with wide variety of scenery
cons:
Lots of newer professors can be demanding on time
Lack of communication from other majors than engineering (since engineering campus is separate)

pros: Their benefits are reasonable. As a faculty member, the teaching load and research flexibility are as expected.
cons: The university simply doesn't care about excellence. They cut corners everywhere. Educational quality is meh. Salaries are mediocre. And they don't want to improve.

pros: Raleigh is an amazing city, especially for couples with children.  The university is a great place to work. Everyone is really nice and supportive.
cons: Since it is a state school, there are a lot of budget cuts happening right now.  This keeps hiring low and raises to a minimum.

review_title: Working at NCSU Student media has been an overall great stepping-stone experience.
pros: The environment is laid back and low pressure. You get what you put into it. You have the opportunity to network and develop business skills. Mistakes are okay and allow you to grow.
cons: Paid by commission so you don't make a lot of money.

pros: The Centennial Campus is wonderful. Lots of new buildings and labs. Staff is always quick to make sure you get paid on time etc. (Which isn't always the case for graduate students.)
cons: The pay is not very high compared to many other schools.

pros: I am a student at NC State and they are incredibly flexible with my schedule. I enjoy all my coworkers and love coming to work every day.
cons: Being a state government sponsored organization, there can be a lot of red tape and hoops to jump through to get the job done.

pros: Very flexible and enjoyable. Takes into account that I am a graduate student and I get enough time for my coursework.  Hours are flexible.
cons: Work can be time-consuming and my computer runs pretty slow, which is true for many of the office equipment.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: NC State has great culture, a great campus, ample resources, and provides a great location.
cons: Computer services are lacking, and intranet services are frustrating to use. Campus is, although beautiful, a little spread out, and the main campus feels very dated.

review_title: Good benefits, experience varies from department to department
pros: Free tuition, internal development opportunities, good state benefits
cons: Hard to get any sort of raise, some friction between departments, poor communication

review_title: Great experience! There are plenty of opportunities for upward, mobile movement.
job_title: Human Resources Specialist in Raleigh, NC
pros: Job security, good benefits and plenty of career opportunities depending on your skill.
cons: Need a create a career path for HR Professionals at a higher level.

pros: It is a good and stable environment to work.  Depending on the department, can get a chance to work on lot of new technologies.
cons: Working at ncsu is not good for growth.  benefits are not good.  salaries are not competitive in comparison to other universities in the unc system.

pros: great benefits, great co workers, great physical environment
cons: I have never had such a passive aggressive group of managers. Instead of working towards the same goal, you are left to fend for yourself and if it's not done right look out. Communication lacks as well between management and staff.

job_title: Graduate Research and Teaching Assistant in Raleigh, NC
pros:
Amazing work atmosphere and co-workers, as well as great installations.
Several learning and training opportunities.
Overall, and incredible institution, full of excellent professionals
cons: There is not really down side for the Forestry and Natural Resources Department at the North Carolina State University, it is a great institution in all senses

review_title: It was a great experience that opened many doors for me.
pros: It is a great and positive environment that provides numerous opportunities for growth and development for its faculty and students.
cons: The only downside to working here is the lack of parking availability and sometimes it can seem a bit crowded.

pros: Opportunities to do fundamental researches and write journal papers.
cons: A lot of corporate companies do not recognize the years you spent as a post doc. So if you want to eventually go to work in the industries, don't waste your time as a post doc.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Raleigh, NC
pros: To get a PhD degree is the only reason. A lot of fellow classmate quit after finishing Master Degree. The income of a Master is way higher than that of a Graduate RA.
cons: Work load depends on professor, but still, in order to have good publication, need to work hard

pros: Flexibility in working hours and almost everything can be done from home if you have wifi access.
cons: The difficulty in acquiring the necessary data from various professors and students can make the job a bit stressful at times.

pros: The work place in the new campus is good but no dinning hall. The research is pretty independent.
cons: The work market for graduate student doesn't seem to be good. Take for a while to find a job after graduation, although the engineer career fair is nice.

review_title: Best part-time student job on campus

cons: Not allowed to work more than 20 hours a week as a student.

review_title: Great school for research and students
pros: A collaborative environment for equipment, committee members, and spaces. I love the open-door policy many/most professors maintain. Innovative research and great industry partners.
cons: Dated buildings, limited funding devoted to research. I wish the university did more to make the campus greener (in all aspects of the word).

pros: Schedules are flexible. You can arrange your time for preparing the class session, office hours, etc. As a part time job, it's great.
cons: It's temporary. The job ends as the semester ends. You have to be assigned to next employment in the next semester.

pros: Ability to create a real learning environment without too much oversight. Staff are superb and are truly helpful in many departments. Ability to reach out and receive help immediately.
cons: Department politics can sometimes get in the way of productivity, but that is to be expected of any company.

review_title: All Cosmetic Actions and no management
job_title: Grounds and Facilities Employee in Cary, NC
pros: Stability, Nice fellow employees, easy to get off from work, if necessary
cons: Lack of Management, Department runs itself. Does not follow what it preaches about equal opportunity. Department does not promote from within. All cosmetic actions, like putting lipstick on a pig, After it is all over, it is still a pig. Waste a ton of money and then raise rates on the kids and parents each year to attend the University.

pros: Works around your schedule and allows you to move up in your position. Great professional staff that wants to see all of the employees succeed.
cons: Turnover rate can be high with college students. Some of the shifts are early in the morning or late at night which is not ideal

review_title: Graduate Student Researcher Dept. of Chemistry
job_title: Graduate Student Researcher Department of Chemistry in Raleigh, NC

Relaxed compared to other chemistry departments. 
Fantastic location.
A wide variety of research opportunities.
Supportive community of researchers in a variety of disciplines and focuses
Student health plan
cons:
Salary is a little low as compared to other local universities.
Facilities need to be updated.
Lack of consistency in requirements for graduation

pros: If you are willing to learn, there are myriad opportunities at NC State University. One thing I learnt in my experience is REACH OUT to people, they are always looking for someone who can help.
cons: I did not feel anything specifically I can relate as a con.

job_title: Undergraduate Program Coordinator in Raleigh, NC
pros: Very good benefits, comprehensive and extensive employee programs, generally a very positive work environment, fostered a sense of community within the Wolfpack.
cons: Being a state institution, there is not a lot of room for upward mobility without leaving departments and roles, and tacking upwards through quasi-lateral moves.

review_title: The University itself is a good community with a challenging and diverse learning environment.
pros: It is a good working environment for learning new things about people and the many different cultures.
cons: The benefit package seems to decline every year and salaries for some do not appear to keep up with the industry.

review_title: Exciting place to work with great people who know what they're doing
pros: Good opportunity for personal growth, good leadership and management, flexible schedules, coworkers easy to interact with, nice modern office space
cons: Communication tenuous at times, open office space shared with people from other organizations can make for awkwardness

job_title: Post Doc Research Associate in Raleigh, NC
pros: Give good benefits, have international environment, sources for research are great. The culture allows cooperation with everybody. My second favorite workplace
cons: Research are hectic, peaks and valleys. The salary is fine but not great. Parking is not easy. Sometimes online systems are not user friendly, sometimes they are great.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Raleigh, NC
pros: Great school, great facilities..I have been provided with a workstation maintained by the university..labs are accessible 24x7..access to all research papers
cons: car parking is not free and quite expensive..not everyone wants to buy car parking...labs have no windows..so you will be completely ignorant of the outside world...

job_title: Purchasing Manager and Supply Chain Analyst in Raleigh, NC
pros: One of the few companies left with a pension plan.  The benefits are fairly good as well.  The environment and work/lift balance is good.
cons: It can be difficult to move up in the organization.  The training for your position could be improved as well.

pros: Great potential for upward mobility, effort is appreciated, work is easy and looks good on a resume.
cons: Pay isn't great, extreme emphasis on professionalism, suffers from "customer is always right" syndrome.

review_title: Overall good colleagues and flexibility, but commitment to inclusion is surface-level
pros:
Decent starting salary for new advisors
Plenty of professional development opportunities
Driven student body
Great networking opportunities
Flexiblity to innovate
cons: Has ar recruitment issue with low-income, minority students. Provides plenty of surface-level representation and events, but does not address creating an inclusive curriculum and climate.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Raleigh, NC
pros: It is a very friendly, open atmosphere in which scientific creativity and imagination are strongly encouraged.

job_title: PhD Research Assistant in Raleigh, NC

job_title: NC State Dining in Raleigh, NC
pros: My employer was very accommodating to my school schedule and I even got free food every now and then. Also, the staff are very friendly.

pros: The culture of NC State is phenomenal. The teachers and staff are very supportive to the growth of the students even after graduation

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Raleigh, NC

pros: Get to work on interesting research topics. A lot of government and industrial funding.

review_title: Reveiw of postdoc position in NCSU

pros: The flexibility and pay are good, the work is low-stress, and it's easy to trade and pick up shifts.

review_title: Wonderful place, very invested in student body
